author: @rdmedic71
text: If you get an error with the m.drawcounties due to encode issues..... Try this.... it worked for me. I found this solution on stackoverflow:    I have the same problem. I've solved it. I replace all "utf-8" with "latin-1" in shapefile.py, which located in ~/Library/Python/3.7/lib/python/site-packages/shapefile.py     Before I could save the changes, I had to get permission to edit the folders.  I followed this youtube tutorial and that fixed that problem.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3LnnvbpO9NI

author: @rdmedic71
text: Sooooo, I'm loving your classes.  However,  I have to point out that latitude is the horizontal lines on the map, and Longitude is the vertical lines on a map. https://journeynorth.org/tm/LongitudeIntro.html I'm curious if this impacts the code example you're giving.  But I digress.  on with the class.  Thanks,

author: @thehornandhoof
text: Latitude are parallel to equator (horizontal) and Longitude go vertical (up to down).  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geographic_coordinate_system#Geographic_latitude_and_longitude  Anyways tons of thanks for great tutorials.
